pageContext.claim: “The Great Patriots of Rolling Thunder WILL be coming back to Washington, D.C. next year, & hopefully for many years to come. It is where they want to be, & where they should be. Have a wonderful time today. Thank you to our great men & women of the Pentagon for working it out!”
pageContext.analysis: Rolling Thunder has held a Memorial Day rally in Washington for 32 years, but announced rising costs would mean 2019 was the last year for the event in the nation's capital though it would continue to be held at 90 local chapters. Despite Trump’s tweet, Rolling Thunder’s founder and executive director Artie Muller affirmed again on this was the last year for the event in the nation’s capital. Muller said on C-Span that nothing had changed. “I know he means well, but I don't know what the story is with them working it out with us,” Muller said. “There’d have to be a lot of discussion and a lot of changes for everybody that comes here and our organization that helps put this together.”
